predicate.note: Frames file for 'sway' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 47.3, Framenet entry Suasion2.

example.name: normally intransitive
example.text: Suddenly the woman begins swaying and then writhing.

example.name: occasionally with EXT
example.text: Staffers at Thompson, whose offices are in the ultramodern Embarcadero Center, watched pictures drop from the walls and then felt the skyscraper sway seven to eight feet, according to a spokeswoman.

example.name: cause to change mind
example.text: As a result, many of those now planning to leave Hong Kong can't easily be swayed *trace* by momentary improvements in the colony's political and economic climate.
example.arg: *trace* -> many of those now planning to leave Hong Kong
momentary improvements in the colony's political and economic climate
